reviews.review:
It seems as though it's trendy to hate this movie, as though hating this movie is some sort of not being a sellot. Truthfully, I didn't expect to like it, with all of he negative press... But I watched it with my 4 year old, and we were pretty thoroughly entertained... The product placement is a little bit cringe worthy at times, but if you haven't bought the narrative that corporations are the devil, it doesn't have to ruin the movie. Featuring the Twitter Logo bird at the end was semi clever, but also the worst example of product placement for me... Since I feel like Twitter is a communication app, where as other apps featured in the movie were pretty harmless.

The 3 main characters are interesting and fun, and some of the lessons about being yourself are good.

Overall we thought the movie was a lot of fun!!! I think a lot of the people hating on this movie are the real cliche... The knee jerk desire to virtue signal is more played out than anything in this movie.
I'll give Sony props for good animation quality and an "ok" storyline, but the idea of an emoji society was dumb and the musical score wasn't very good.

This movie sucked!! The emoji movie was a plain rip off of Wreak It Ralph, Inside out, and The LEGO Movie. The script and jokes were so lazy. This was the worst movie Iâ€™ve ever seen since batman and Robin. This is the worst movie of 2017 and one of the worst movies of all time. The emoji movie was so terrible that I had to stop watching 30 or 40 minutes in! Please save your money!
This movie was so bad it was funny. Definitely a movie to watch and laugh at with friends
just complete shit if possible zero stars
A great movie for gay kids, stay away kids
BEST MOVIE OF THE YEAR, GREAT ANIMATION, PLOT AND COMEDY. I NEED A SEQUEL!! :)

The Emoji Movie is by far the best movie of all time. This is the only movie that has ever made me think, "I really wish this website had a 7-star option!" The plot is simple, beautiful, and effective. There is an emoji named Gene who lives in Textopolis, the world inside teenager Alex's phone. He is special because he has multiple emotions and therefore cannot fit in. Eventually, he screws up his face when Alex is texting a girl and it wreaks havoc throughout the smartphone, and he must go on wacky misadventures with his friends Hi-Five and Jailbreak. This plot is elegant on its own, but is complemented by wonderful character development, great animation, and, most notably, outstanding and HILARIOUS jokes, that made me feel like https://bit.ly/2raIDRs. The character Poop, performed by Sir Patrick Stewart, is by far the best character in the film, with his extremely witty jokes that rival (and even surpass) those of the Minions movie. My only complaint about this wonderful experience of a movie is that 1  poop joke every 2 minutes in the first 10 minutes is not nearly enough. For a sequel, I would love it if there were 2 poop jokes a minute throughout the entire film, to further enhance the wonderous comedy.

Overall, I would give the Emoji Movie https://bit.ly/2I5KRLy stars.
it was a great movie. you all hate nice things.
